doc.field: A different shot focusing more on the CN Tower and Rogers Centre. Taken from atop the Maple Leaf Quay buildings across the QEW.
street light toronto ontario night downtown cntower buildling mapleleafquay rogerscentre 18200mmf3556gvr
I love the view I get from my balcony every day. Just looking out soothes the soul for me as I can view the horizon from one side to the other. *Buildings seem farther than they actually are.
panorama view balcony toronto eastyork downtown cntower ontario green grass forest tree sky cloud
At the base of the CN Tower, as you exit the elvators, people walk by the gift shop where you can buy anything and everything CN Tower related.
art shop store cntower gift nuitblanche 2007 wonderfulnuit

The recent lightning storm connected with the CN Tower several times while I waited with my camera, giving me many chances at getting a good shot. It was an electrifying evening that was well worth getting my camera wet a little.

The recent lightning storm connected with the CN Tower several times while I waited with my camera, giving me many chances at getting a good shot. It was an electrifying evening that was well worth getting my camera wet a little.

The recent lightning storm connected with the CN Tower several times while I waited with my camera, giving me many chances at getting a good shot. It was an electrifying evening that was well worth getting my camera wet a little.
Taken from the Sky Pod of the CN Tower, up waaaaay up high in the sky, the soft glowing lights of King Street make this look much like a video game scene. It reminded me somewhat of Tron.
city light art night glow cntower tron kingstreet nuitblanche 2007 roythompsonhall wonderfulnuit

Sitting my camera on top of the life guard stand located in the middle of the sandy beach, this was the result of a 30 second exposure. The gentle glow of the city lights contrasts the silouhette of the trees in the foreground. The intermittent lights from above the boardwalk is another interesting place that is worth shooting at night. The CN Tower is visible in the backdrop, with its now LED-illuminated sides.
longexposure light toronto silhouette night sand glow cntower boardwalk thebeach thebeaches

On our way down, the elevator guy was kind enough to wait as I took this shot. He insisted I take my time to get a good shot and even closed the elevator doors as I set up my tripod and set the shot. You're essentially looking straight up 1122ft342m as this elevator goes up to the Observation deck.
art up cntower elevator shaft nuitblanche 2007 wonderfulnuit

Looking at the business district buildings from atop the sky pod.

The view as seen from the rooftop of the Maple Leaf Queen's Quay buildings near harbourfront.
light toronto night downtown cntower mapleleafquay supershot 18200mmf3556gvr rogercentre

<b>Sunday March 5, 2006 4:34am<b> | <a href"http:www.flickr.comphotossmaku109055542">4:36am<a> On my way home from a friend's birthday party, I decided it was too late to go home, sleep, wake up and drive downtown again for the next morning. I made the executive decision to drive around the empty streets of Toronto and take pictures in the night. Despite the -17 celsius weather, I still ventured out as my photographer's itch got the better of me. These impromptu shoots are always fun. I always have my tripod and camera gear wherever I go so this made things a lot easier in making my decision. First stop: the intersection of Bathurst St. and Fort York Blvd. Facing East off the bridge, the picture above shows the construction going on at Cityplace, the multi-condominium complex. It was such a clear night that you can even see the stars in these photos. For the next few days, I'll be posting a new picture from this series. <a href"http:static.flickr.com50108586683_91a031f2e5_o.jpg">Best seen in its original size<a>! <b>Camera:<b> Nikon D200 <b>Lens:<b> Nikkor 24mm f2.8 D <b>Shutter Speed:<b> 20 sec. <b>F-Stop:<b> f7.1 <b>Sensitivity:<b> ISO 400
morning light toronto night long exposure cityscape cntower dri rogerscentre 24mmf28d torontoearlymorningshoot nikonstunninggallery

On my way down, a few of us went outside to the observation level. This level is slightly below the skypod and is where the bulk of the people go to see the cityviews. The screen makes the viewing a little distracting but you are open to the fresh air. I walked all around the level looking for an empty area with no people and finally found one, only to be quickly followed by a security guard telling me to go back down the elevator. "Yeah, yeah, just one more shot," I kept telling them. ;)
city light reflection art window night glow cntower deck tron nuitblanche 2007 wonderfulnuit observationslevel

Looking West down Lakeshore Rd., I managed to find an empty side of the skypod as people started heading back down to ground level. The security guys were rushing us back down at this point, as they were keen on getting the last bit of photographers away from the windows and heading towards the elevators.
city light reflection art window night glow cntower deck tron nuitblanche 2007 skypod wonderfulnuit
